SecurityIssue.Description: Declare objects with appropriate storage durations.
SecurityIssue.Recommendation: Ensure that objects are declared with storage durations suitable for their use.
Ensure all identifiers are declared before use to prevent undefined behavior.

SecurityIssue.Description: Do not declare an identifier with conflicting linkage classifications.
SecurityIssue.Recommendation: Avoid conflicting linkage classifications to ensure consistent and predictable behavior.

SecurityIssue.Description: Do not declare or define a reserved identifier.
SecurityIssue.Recommendation: Avoid using reserved identifiers to prevent conflicts and undefined behavior.

SecurityIssue.Description: Use the correct syntax when declaring a flexible array member.
SecurityIssue.Recommendation: Ensure the correct syntax is used for flexible array members to avoid undefined behavior.

SecurityIssue.Description: Avoid information leakage when passing a structure across a trust boundary.
SecurityIssue.Recommendation: Ensure structures are sanitized when crossing trust boundaries to prevent information leakage.

SecurityIssue.Description: Do not create incompatible declarations of the same function or object.
SecurityIssue.Recommendation: Ensure consistent declarations of functions and objects across translation units.

SecurityIssue.Description: Do not declare variables inside a switch statement before the first case label.
SecurityIssue.Recommendation: Declare variables outside switch statements or within case blocks to ensure proper initialization.
